title: AI-Powered Fraud Detection System
description: Implemented ML-based fraud detection system reducing chargebacks by 35% while maintaining low false positive rates.
fullDescription: A real-time fraud detection system using ensemble ML models to identify suspicious transactions before authorization. Balances fraud prevention with customer friction through adaptive risk scoring.
problem: Rule-based fraud systems were either too aggressive (blocking legitimate transactions) or too permissive (high fraud losses).
constraints: Must process decisions in under 50ms. Cannot significantly impact conversion rates.
approach: Built ensemble model combining gradient boosting with neural networks. Implemented feedback loops for continuous learning.
tradeoffs: Chose explainable models over pure accuracy to support regulatory requirements. Accepted some false negatives to minimize customer friction.
execution: 8-month development with 2 ML engineers and 2 backend engineers. A/B tested extensively before full rollout.
outcomes: 35% chargeback reduction, 3% improvement in approval rate for good transactions, $1.5M annual fraud savings.
whatIdImprove: Would invest in better feature engineering pipeline earlier. Would also build more sophisticated model monitoring.
